ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 20 hours per week
7 hours.
5 hours
10-20 depending on the problem set

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: Very good course, much work but felt stills improving all semester. Would highly recommend to anyone interested in future work in statistics.
Strength: Wonderful lectures. Weakness: Hard homework without solutions, which makes it very hard to understand which parts go wrong.
Very good. You can definitely learn a lot.
could be improved by going through how to code the examples we go over in class
pros:introduced a lot of tools in computational statistics. cons: not very theoretical.

The lectures are well organized, informative and easy to understand. The lectures and the homework keep a good balance between theories and application (like programming), and maintain an appropriate workload. I actually don't have a very clear suggestion for improvements for now.
Very useful course!
Awesome!
This course is super good in terms of computational stat, it covers all the important algorithms, which is extremely helpful for the research.
This course helps me learn a lot about computational skills. I think it is perfect!
strengths: interesting/revelant materiel, weakness: sometimes tested on topics not covered in class.

This is an excellent course. The instructor is an engaging speaker and is able to explain concepts that could be confusing in a very straightforward and clear way, such that they seem quite intuitive. The problem sets and exams are challenging but reasonable, and everything that one might need to know to solve them is included in the course. The instructor and teaching fellow made themselves very available outside of class time so that we had every opportunity to ask the questions that we needed to. I would highly recommend this course to another student.
Well organized Sometimes hw is not related to learning materials

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Forrest Crawford  Instructor was very helpful and clear in lectures and available for office hours.
Instructor: Forrest Crawford  Strength: Good lecturing. Weakness: No typed notes and homework solutions, which makes this course inefficient.
Instructor: Forrest Crawford  Great instructor. Very patient and intelligent. Also funny.
Instructor: Forrest Crawford  Dr. Crawford explains everything clearly. He is patient and responsible.
Instructor: Forrest Crawford  Prof. Crawford is excellent. His class is very helpful.
Instructor: Forrest Crawford  Dr. Crawford gives the lectures in an interesting way. He is very accessible and responsive to our questions. And also, his hand-drawn 3D plots are impressing.
Instructor: Forrest Crawford  Very nice instructor! Very inspired for different approaches.
Instructor: Forrest Crawford  Awesome!
Instructor: Forrest Crawford  He is so good at explaining the ideas of different computational methods and so nice.
Instructor: Forrest Crawford  I really like Dr. Forrest's style! He's an intelligent and kind instructor. I appreciate his help!
Instructor: Forrest Crawford  great professor, helpful office hours, good at explaining theoretical topics.

Instructor: Forrest Crawford  The instructor's teaching style was great - his explanations of both concepts in the course and the expectations in the course were always very clear. The course is well-designed in the sense that the problem sets ensured that we grasped the important ideas taught in the class and were able to use them.
Instructor: Forrest Crawford  Great instructor Organized and knowledgeable
Instructor: Forrest Crawford  His explanation is very clear and easy understood

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: A lot of work and challenging, but will learn a lot. Would recommend to a serious student.
Great course if you want to enhance your computational skills. Very useful techniques and the homework problem settings are very realistic.
You can learn a lot by finishing assignments. Great course overall.
Great course! Yes.
An interesting and easy-to-understanding introduction to statistical computing theories and techniques. I would recommend it to students who are interested in, or who need, skills in related fields.
Great class! Useful Techniques
I think every computational guy should take this course, in the future, you will definitely use something from this course.
I would recommend this course to another student. It's helpful and interesting!
best class I've taken
See question 6.
Great course, learnt a lot of important topics
